wikipedia_page.main: Frederick William Pearce Jago (fl. 1838–1892) was a scholar best known for his work The Ancient Language and the Dialect of Cornwall, originally published 1882 by Netherton and Worth of Truro. He also published a Cornish dictionary in 1887. He settled at Bodmin in 1843 where he practised medicine.

response: * Fred W. P. Jago (fl. 1838–1892), scholar of the Cornish language

He studied the decline of the Cornish language and concluded in his work The Ancient Cathedral of CornwallFred W. P. Jago (1882), The Ancient Language and the Dialect of Cornwall. Truro: Netherton and Worth (reissued by AMS Press, NY, 1983), pp.4 ff.
*Fred W. P. Jago, linguist and physician
